## Assessment Area

```{r} 
#| label: fig-map
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
#| fig-cap: "Map of the assessment area and management areas for sablefish off the U.S. West Coast."
#| fig-alt: "Map of the U.S. West Coast showing Washington, Oregon, and California. This assessment assumes a coastwide assessment area for the U.S. West Coast with management areas split north and south of 36° N. latitude north latitude."
#| fig-width: 7
#| fig-height: 8

mod.names <- c("Management  Range", "Assessment Range")
mod.cols  <- c("blue","lightblue", "yellow")

map('worldHires', regions=c("Canada","Mexico"),
    xlim=c(-130, -114), ylim=c(31, 51),
    col='grey', fill=TRUE, interior=TRUE, , lwd=1)

# map with US states
map('state', regions=c("Wash","Oreg","Calif","Idaho", "Montana","Nevada","Arizona","Utah"),
    add = TRUE,
    col = 'grey', fill = TRUE, interior = TRUE, lwd = 1)
axis(2, at = seq(32, 50, 2), lab = paste0(seq(32, 50, 2), "°N"), las=1)
axis(1, at = seq(-130, -114, 4), lab = paste0(abs(seq(-130, -114, 4)), "°W"))

## add vertical lines indicating range for each stock
# North of 36
text(-128-.8, 40.5, mod.names[1], srt=90)
latrange <- c(32.5, 36) + c(.2, -.2)
lines(rep(-128, 2), latrange, lwd=10, col=mod.cols[1])

# South of 36
latrange <- c(36, 48.5) + c(.2, -.2)
lines(rep(-128, 2), latrange, lwd = 10, col=mod.cols[2])
#text(-128-.8, mean(latrange), mod.names[1], srt=90)
# Assessment area
latrange <- c(32.5, 48.5) + c(.2, -.2)
lines(rep(-126,2), latrange, lwd=10, col=mod.cols[3])
text(-126-.8, mean(latrange), mod.names[2], srt=90)

text(-120, 50, "Canada")
text(-120, 47, "Washington")
text(-121, 44, "Oregon")
text(-119.5, 37, "California")
text(-115.5, 32.1, "Mexico")


``` 


![Time series of sablefish biomass-based and fishing-based estimates of status in Alaska, British Columbia, and along the U.S. West Coast from the most recent stock assessments. The arrow indicates estimates for the current year of the stock assessment. Vertical and horizontal axes differ by area due to region-dependent reference point use and specifications.](figures/regional_Kobe.png){#fig-reg-kobe height=7in fig-alt="The stock in both Alaska and British Columbia is assessed to be above the management target with harvest less that the target harvest rate. The U.S. West Coast stock is assessed to be below the biomass target with harest less than the target harvest rate in 2024."}

## Data

```{r} 
#| label: fig-data
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
#| fig-cap: "Data used in the base model."
#| fig-alt: "Line plot with years from 1890-2024 along the x-axis and varying data types used in the assessment along the y-axis. Catch data available from 1890 to 2024 for all fleets. Indices of abundance available starting in 1980 to 2004 and age data from the fishery and surveys available from 1893 to 2024. Age composition data starting in 1983 for the trawl, hook-and-line, and pot fleets.  Age composition data starting in 2006 for the discard fleets. Age composition data from fishery-independent surveys starting in 1983. The WCGBTS survey age composition data were available each year from 2003 through 2024, excluding 2020."

knitr::include_graphics(
  file.path(model_dir, "plots", "data_plot.png")
)

``` 

\newpage

```{r} 
#| label: fig-landings
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
#| fig-cap: "Removals in metric tons (mt) by year for trawl, pot, and hook-and line gears."
#| fig-alt: "Barplot with year on the x-axis and removals in metric tons on the y-axis. Removals before the 1970s were less than 5,000 mt by year with landings sharply increasing in the 1970s and early 1980s and landings since ranging between approximately 5,000 to 7,500 mt by year."

landings <- model_output$catch |> 
  dplyr::mutate(
    year = Yr,
    catch_mt = dead_bio,
    Fleet = dplyr::case_when(
      Fleet_Name == "Trawl_Discard" ~ "Trawl Discard",
      Fleet_Name == "Hook_and_Line_Discard" ~ "Hook-and-Line Discard",
      Fleet_Name == "Pot_Discard" ~ "Pot Discard",
      .default = Fleet_Name)
  )
  
ggplot2::ggplot(landings, ggplot2::aes(x = year, y = catch_mt, fill = Fleet)) +
  ggplot2::geom_bar(stat = 'identity') +
  ggplot2::theme_bw() +
  ggplot2::xlab("Year") + ggplot2::ylab("Removals (mt)") +
  ggplot2::scale_y_continuous(
    labels = function(x) format(x, big.mark = ",", scientific = FALSE)) +
  ggplot2::scale_fill_viridis_d() +
  ggplot2::theme(
    strip.text.x = ggplot2::element_blank(),
    strip.background = ggplot2::element_rect(colour="white", fill="white"),
    legend.key.height = ggplot2::unit(0.05, "cm"),
    legend.position = c(0.20, 0.75))

```

\pagebreak

```{r} 
#| label: fig-landings-comparison
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
#| fig-cap: "Comparison of the total removals in metric tons (mt) by year between this assessment and the 2023 assessment."
#| fig-alt: "Line plot comparing removals in the 2023 assessment to those used in this assessment with year on the x-axis and total removals in metric tons on the y-axis. The removals between this assessment and the 2023 assessment are nearly equal for all years in the model."

catch_comparison <- dplyr::bind_rows(
  model_output_2023$catch |>
    dplyr::group_by(Yr) |>
    dplyr::summarise(
      assessment = "2023",
      total = sum(kill_bio)),
  model_output$catch |>
    dplyr::group_by(Yr) |>
    dplyr::summarise(
      assessment = "2025",
      total = sum(dead_bio))
) |>
  dplyr::rename(Year = Yr)

ggplot2::ggplot(catch_comparison, ggplot2::aes(x = Year, y = total, color = assessment, linetype = assessment)) +
  ggplot2::geom_line(linewidth = 1) +
  ggplot2::scale_color_viridis_d(begin = 0, end = 0.5) +
  ggplot2::theme_bw() + 
  ggplot2::xlab("Year") + ggplot2::ylab("Total Removals (mt)") 

```

```{r} 
#| label: fig-positive-lat-wcgbt
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
#| fig-cap: "Proportion of tows where sablefish was present or absent across all years by latitude for the NWFSC West Coast Groundfish Bottom Trawl Survey."
#| fig-alt: "Barplot with latitude on the x-axis and proportion on the y-axis. The proportion of postive tows is approximately 75 percent of all tows north of Point Conception with a lower proportion positive south of Point Conception between 25 to 45 percent."

 nwfscSurvey::plot_proportion(
    data = wcgbt_catch |> 
      dplyr::mutate(new = factor(cpue_kg_km2 <= 0, levels = c(FALSE, TRUE), labels = c("Present", "Absent"))),
    column_factor = new,
    column_bin = Latitude_dd,
    width = 1,
    boundary = 0,
    bar_width = "equal"
  ) 

```

```{r} 
#| label: fig-maturity-data
#| echo: false 
#| warning: false 
#| eval: true 
#| fig-cap: "Samples by age that were determined to be functionally mature and immature north and south of 36° N. latitude. Immature fish have a functional maturity of 0 and mature fish have a functional maturity of 1. Blue vertical dashed line at age 7."
#| fig-alt: "Data plotted with age in years along the x-axis and functional maturity along the y-axis with data plotted separately north and south. Age associated with immature and mature fish by area. In the north fish are mature at younger ages more frequently compared to fish in the south."

load(here::here("data", "maturity_data.rda"))

ggplot2::ggplot(maturity_data |>
  dplyr::mutate(
    Area = dplyr::case_when(latitude >= 36 ~ "North", .default = "South")), 
    ggplot2::aes(x = age, y = functional_maturity)) +
  ggplot2::geom_point() +
  ggplot2::ylab("Functional Maturity") +
  ggplot2::geom_vline(xintercept = 7, color = "blue", linetype = 2) + 
  ggplot2::xlab("Age years") +
  ggplot2::theme_bw() +
  ggplot2::theme(strip.background = ggplot2::element_rect(fill = "white")) +
  ggplot2::facet_wrap(Area ~ .)

```

![Comparison of estimated summary biomass for ages 3+ when the estimation of annual recruitment deviations is revised.](figures/3_structure_compare18_smrybio.png){#fig-structure-bridge-summary-3 height=3in fig-alt="Line plot with year on the x-axis and age 3 plus biomass on the y-axis. Changing the main period for the estimation of recruitment deviation to run from 1975 through 2023 increases the estimate of unfished age 3 plus biomass to approximately 600,000 metric tons compared to the previous model that assumed a main period of 1925 through 2023 estimate of approximately 350,000 metric tons. The estimated age 3 plus biomass at the end of the time series were similar around 400,000 metric tons. The next bridging run that did not estimate early recruitment deviations from 1892 to 1974 estimated similar age 3 plus biomass at the start of the time series to the model with main deviations from 1975 to 2023, but the model with no early deviations estimated higher age 3 plus biomass at the end of the time series of greater than 450,000 metric tons. Section 3.3.3 model changes from the last assessment describes in detail the changes to estimates."}

![Comparison of estimated fraction unfished (i.e., stock status) when the estimation of annual recruitment deviations is revised.](figures/3_structure_compare3_Bratio.png){#fig-structure-bridge-depl-3 height=3in fig-alt="Line plot with year on the x-axis and fraction unfished on the y-axis. Changing the main period for the estimation of recruitment deviation to run from 1975 through 2023 estimated a more depleted population across th majority of the time sers compared to the previous model that assumed a main period of 1925 through 2023. The estimated fraction of unfished for the shorter main deviation period model was approximately 37 percent compared to 55 percent of the previous model. The next bridging run that did not estimate early recruitment deviations from 1892 to 1974 estimated a less depleted population through 2000 compared to the model with the main deviation period of 1975 through 2023. The final estimate of fraction of unfished was approximately 45 percent in 2025. Section 3.3.3 model changes from the last assessment describes in detail the changes to estimates."}

![Comparison of estimated annual recruitment deviations when the estimation of annual recruitment deviations is revised.](figures/3_structure_compare11_recdevs.png){#fig-structure-bridge-rec-dev-3 height=3in fig-alt="Plot with year on the x-axis and recruitment deviations in log-space on the y-axis.
